intro: Atriplex halimus var. argutidens, commonly known as the Armenian saltbush, is a shrub native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the Amaranthaceae family. Its salt-tolerant nature makes it well adapted to saline soils, and it is often found in coastal or desert areas. This variety is also valued for its ornamental appeal and use in landscaping in drought-prone regions.
